com.marklogic.mgmt.api

Class Resource

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.marklogic.mgmt.api.ApiObject
      • com.marklogic.mgmt.api.Resource
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Amp, Database, ExternalSecurity, Forest, Group, Privilege, ProtectedCollection, Role, Server, Task, User

    public abstract class Resource
extends ApiObject
    Base class for any class that we both want to read/write from/to JSON and make calls to the Management REST API.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        public java.lang.String save()
        Returns:
        a receipt string containing the path and HTTP status code

      • delete

        public java.lang.String delete()
        Returns:
        a receipt with the path (if the resource was found), the resource ID, and whether the resource was deleted

      • list

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> list()
        TODO Not totally convinced about putting this method here, as it means that an instance of this is needed to get a list of names. The other choices would be a method on the API class, but then that means the API class needs a method per resource for getting a list of names, whereas with this approach, we have a single method.
        Returns:
        a list of names of all resources of this type.

      • exists

        public boolean exists()
        Returns:
        true of the resource exists, false otherwise

      • getResourceUrlParams

        public java.lang.String[] getResourceUrlParams()
        Some resources, such as amps, require additional parameters in the URL to uniquely identify the resource. A subclass can override this to provide those parameters.
        Returns:

      • getResourceManager

        protected abstract ResourceManager getResourceManager()
        Returns:
        a ResourceManager instance that will be used for the persistence methods in this class

      • getResourceId

        protected abstract java.lang.String getResourceId()
        Returns:
        the unique identifier for this resource, which will be used for the persistence methods in this class

      • getResourceLabel

        protected java.lang.String getResourceLabel()
        Returns:
        a value that is a useful label for identifying this resource instance, which can be used for log messages. Defaults to getResourceId, as that's normally a good candidate for a label.
